alert.note: Alert for Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County; Laramie Valley; North Laramie Range; North Snowy Range Foothills; Shirley Basin; Snowy Range; South Laramie Range; Upper North Platte River Basin (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 03 at 1:00PM MST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A SNOW SQUALL WILL AFFECT SOUTHEASTERN CARBON...ALBANY AND SOUTHERN CONVERSE COUNTIES... At 1259 PM MST...A snow squall was along a line extending from 6 miles northwest of Medicine Bow to near French Creek Campground...and moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 35 mph and visibilities less than one half mile. SOURCE...Radar and Webcams. IMPACT...Hazardous travel conditions due to slick roads and low visibilities. Locations impacted include... Laramie, Albany, Medicine Bow, Rock River, Bosler, Brooklyn Lake Campground, Woods Landing-Jelm, Friend Park Campground, Nash Fork Campground, Rob Roy Reservoir, Lake Owen, Arlington, Bobbie Thompson Campground, Hutton Lake, Brooklyn Lake, Sugar Loaf Campground, Libby Creek Campground, University Of Wyoming War Memorial Stadium, Bow River Campground and Illinois Creek Campground. This includes Interstate 80 in Wyoming between mile markers 264 and 314. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Expect rapid changes in weather and road conditions. Motorists are urged to use extreme caution if traveling through these areas! Rapid visibility reduction and potentially icy roads are likely to produce hazardous driving conditions. Travel is not advised during this snow squall. If you are traveling and encounter adverse winter driving conditions, reduce speed and make sure headlights are on to increase the visibility of your vehicle to those around you.
